title: How to Make a Code Wheel

steps.title: You need two concentric circles (one circle should be larger than the other).
steps.content: You need two concentric circles (one circle should be larger than the other). Punch a hole in the middle of both and attach with a brass fastener so the top wheel (the smaller one) can move independent of the bottom wheel.

steps.title: Drawing over the entire circle, divide into 26 sections.
steps.content: Drawing over the entire circle, divide into 26 sections. Use a protractor to get each segment the same size -- they should be about 13.8 degrees each

steps.title: Write the letters of the alphabet, in order, on both circles.
steps.content: Write the letters of the alphabet, in order, on both circles.

steps.title: To use, determine a number to use a cipher, for example:
steps.content: To use, determine a number to use a cipher, for example: 4.

steps.title: Turn the inner wheel that number of turns (so A >> E, B >> F, etc).
steps.content: Turn the inner wheel that number of turns (so A >> E, B >> F, etc). When writing the letter, look at the inner wheel and write down the letter that is matched on the outer wheel.

steps.title: For additional complexity, use a cipher that changes on each letter (such as the digits of π or the numerical digits of a sentence).
steps.content: For additional complexity, use a cipher that changes on each letter (such as the digits of π or the numerical digits of a sentence).
